snippet: Prices rose in 2013 for the third consecutive year after lagging inflation for more than 20 years.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column asserts that the era of cheap clothing may be ending for United States, as trend of last two decades of declining apparel prices seems to be reversing, albeit by small amounts; says prices of imports rose in 2013 for third consecutive year after lagging inflation for more than 20 years.
lead_paragraph: Prices rose in 2013 for the third consecutive year after lagging inflation for more than 20 years.

headline.print_headline: Era of Cheap Apparel May Be Ending for U.S.
headline.main: Era of Cheap Apparel May Be Ending for U.S.
